channel.title: Hal.dll
channel.description:
When I boot my iMac, it shows this when I boot it on my xp:
[code] Windows could not start because the following file is missing or corrupt: <Windows root>\system32\hal.dll. Please re-install a copy of the above file [/code]
I don't wanna format, and when I input my XP installation disk and boot from it, it doesn't show the repair options.
How do I fix this on my Mac?
I can go into the XP hdd, but won't let me edit it. How do I edit it
or
How do I fix the error in another way?
PS: IT'S ALL ONE COMPUTER, IT'S AN iMAC WITH BOOTCAMP AND WINDOWS XP AS ANOTHER PARTITION.

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I did some research after Googling Hal.dll error. And I found that it’s a somewhat common error. And is more associated with the boot.ini file. Which may be the real problem, and not the hal.dll.

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:8, topic:190173”]You do know that Mac based on Unix, right?

[quote author=io9 link=topic=253218.msg2115786#msg2115786 date=1205769755]
Get an Ubuntu Live CD, do sudo mount /dev/<hard drive device> /mnt/<whereever you wanna mount it> and then sudo <file manager's name here> /mnt/<wherever you mounted it> from there, you can go into \Windows\System32, and get a copy from someone who has XP of hal.dll

eg, on Ubuntu, you would do

sudo mount /dev/<drive device /media/<drive device> sudo nautilus /media/<drive device>

Also, you’d need the x86 version of Ubuntu.

[/quote][/quote]

More info, please?

the path to the hal.dl_ is at: /Volumes/WinLite/i386/hal.dl_
and the path to the system32 folder is at: /Volumes/Untitled/WINDOWS/system32

just do I type where those tags are, I’m confused

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You do know that Mac based on Unix, right?

[quote=“io9, post:2, topic:190173”]Get an Ubuntu Live CD, do sudo mount /dev/<hard drive device> /mnt/<whereever you wanna mount it> and then sudo <file manager's name here> /mnt/<wherever you mounted it> from there, you can go into \Windows\System32, and get a copy from someone who has XP of hal.dll

eg, on Ubuntu, you would do

sudo mount /dev/<drive device /media/<drive device> sudo nautilus /media/<drive device>

Also, you’d need the x86 version of Ubuntu.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:5, topic:190173”]Dude, go online. Google hal.dll. Download it. Copy it, and paste it onto the Windows Hard Drive. In c:/WINDOWS/system32/.

EDIT: I put a zip file of the .dll, just download the attachment.[/quote]

Mopman:

You don’t need to use Ubuntu, if you can’t boot into windows, just boot from the Windows cd and press R when it says. You get a command line from which you can use the “expand” tool to get hal.dll from the CD onto your partition.

If you guys read my post, I can’t do any of those following.

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You don’t need to use Ubuntu, if you can’t boot into windows, just boot from the Windows cd and press R when it says. You get a command line from which you can use the “expand” tool to get hal.dll from the CD onto your partition.

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Dude, go online. Google hal.dll. Download it. Copy it, and paste it onto the Windows Hard Drive. In c:/WINDOWS/system32/.

EDIT: I put a zip file of the .dll, just download the attachment.

Read full topic

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

There is a difference in what you will do, and what you cba to, and usually the cba stuff is the stuff that won’t fail…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Like with it’s terminal or w/e

dun wanna go get the CD.

item.title: Hal.dll
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Get an Ubuntu Live CD, do sudo mount /dev/<hard drive device> /mnt/<whereever you wanna mount it> and then sudo <file manager's name here> /mnt/<wherever you mounted it> from there, you can go into \Windows\System32, and get a copy from someone who has XP of hal.dll

eg, on Ubuntu, you would do

sudo mount /dev/<drive device /media/<drive device> sudo nautilus /media/<drive device>

Also, you’d need the x86 version of Ubuntu.

Read full topic
